meanings.definition: A vehicle on rails used for transporting passengers, typically in a city.
meanings.sent1: The trams in the city are always crowded during rush hour.
meanings.sent2: I took the tram to get to work this morning.
meanings.sent3: The tram driver had to stop suddenly, causing everyone to sway.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts moved along the tracks of her mind like trams on a busy street.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the tram bell echoed through the streets, signaling its arrival.

meanings.definition: The tracks on which trams run.
meanings.sent1: The maintenance crew checked the tram tracks for any damage.
meanings.sent2: The tram derailed due to a broken section of the tracks.
meanings.sent3: The kids played near the tram tracks, pretending they were on a grand adventure.
meanings.sent4: The tram tracks gleamed under the sunlight, guiding the way for the approaching tram.
meanings.sent5: The tram tracks snaked through the city, connecting different neighborhoods.

meanings.sent1: We decided to tram to the museum instead of taking a taxi.
meanings.sent2: She trams to work every day to avoid traffic.
meanings.sent3: I tram to the park on weekends for a relaxing time.
meanings.sent4: He trams across town to meet his friends at the cafe.
meanings.sent5: Tramming through the city allows you to see different sights along the way.
